TopicTitle: Just a Question for all you Hardcore KSP-ers out There

Articles.Content: Does your Inner Monologue have Scott Manley's voice?
I'm afraid is Chatterer, and makes as much sense.
Leonard Nimoy narrates my adventures.
When I think about it, sometimes yes ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) or Neil DeGrasse Tyson or Carl Sagan when it's more epic
If I have any sort of narration to my missions, it's in my own voice. It's my own adventure, why shouldn't it be?
Jules Bergman

My ears are filled with the beat of *Asari Progressive Trance* thanks to Mass Effect 2 for quite a while now, so no narrations needed ever ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Just endless maniacal laughter here.
Boris Karloff.
My inner monologue has the voice of ULA's launch commentator...
My own voice. And I don't do inner monologues. Monologues are best when there is more than one person to listen.

For some reason I have

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/aJs7o26RuPo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
 running through my head....
????

JR
I just hear my own voices.

> 
> Just endless maniacal laughter here.

> 
> My own voice. And I don't do inner monologues. Monologues are best when there is more than one person to listen.

For some reason I have both of these.

Nope. 

Best,

-Slashy
I've been playing since .21 and have never watched a Scott Manley video. So no. Dr. Tyson's voice would probably be the one I'd opt for, or maybe Benjamin Sisko's.
My own voice. And it's not inner ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Does your Inner Monologue have Scott Manley's voice?

What, KSP causes you to hear voices inside your head?

Levon Helm. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

[https://youtu.be/KjUlUf0fybA?t=1m1s](https://youtu.be/KjUlUf0fybA?t=1m1s)

I'd want it to be Stephen Hawking. Or Barry White.

But it's usually me talking to my screen with my nose pinched. "Hey Bob !"

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-02T20:22:59Z" title="08/02/2015 08:22  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 2, 2015</time> by Plume & Akakak**
  
warm bass voice added.

Roar of my rockets drowns my inner voice. I hear it only when explosions end. It says: I told you so! ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)
I don't always do inner narration but when I do, I prefer a pirate voice. And it usually says, "Aarrrr, here there be Krakens."
Nah, Scott Manely has a slight american twang to his accent. I prefer my own, pure bred Scottish accent.

I do on and off running commentary, no inner monologues allowed in my ksp.

EDIT: I broke that rule already. I've found my inner monologue is the one and only me! Who would have thought!?

I think Gordon Freeman does my inner monologues.

Oh wait..
